params.content:
You will be given two options A and B, and a comment. Your job is to identify the preference between the two given options in the comment. 
The names of the two options and the comment are delimited with triple backticks.

Here are the rules:
You MUST NOT use the options' real names.
You MUST refer to the options as A or B. 
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond with ```A is preferred over B``` if option A is preferred over option B.
You MUST respond with ```B is preferred over A``` if option B is preferred over option A.
You MUST respond with ```Equal preference``` if options A and B are equally preferred.
You MUST respond with ```No preference```, ```A is preferred over B```, ```B is preferred over A```, or ```Equal preference```.

Option A: ```Java```
Option B: ```PHP```
Comment: ```Use our Java, Ruby and PHP sample code to make it even easier for you to start working with OnlineMQ.```

Option A: ```MySQL```
Option B: ```PostgreSQL```
Comment: ```Allen downloaded the free versions of both databases and found MySQL 4 easier to use than PostgreSQL.```

Option A: ```Windows Vista```
Option B: ```Windows XP```
Comment: ```According to many industry experts Windows Vista drains notebook battery life faster than Windows XP.```

Option A: ```Intel```
Option B: ```Kingston```
Comment: ```Current build ( Rev. 9/12 ): Antec NSK-3480, OCZ-600w PSU; Intel DH55tc 1156/mATX [pre-9/12: Asus P7H55-M] no more ASUS!; i5-760, 2.8gb; Kingston 16gb memory (low boys); Gigabyte ATI 5870 w/ stock heatsink and fans (runs hot!); Gellid Tranquillo CPU cooler w/ Arctic Cooling PWM; case cooling fans- two Nexus 12cm RS fans at 1000 rpm.```
